utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, it’s done. Look, guys, for the future, I don’t mind killing the big spiders, but you have to at least try with the little ones.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, please, we’re facing a far more serious problem than stray arachnids.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not bad? It’s horrible. I mean, you hear stories about this sort of thing, but you never think it’ll happen to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So they steamed your dumplings, get over it. New topic, please.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, Penny, let me take this opportunity to point out that you are looking particularly ravishing today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not with a thousand condoms, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, there is a number.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, new topic, please. Hey, did you hear the people upstairs in 5A are moving out?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Shh-shh-shh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The people upstairs are moving out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The horror!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you just say something like that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, no, no…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How else was I supposed to say it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Slowly, like putting a new fish in a tank. You don’t just drop it in, you let the bag sit in the water a while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The horror!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m sure it’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not going to be fine, change is never fine. They say it is, but it’s not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, honey, did you even know the people that are moving out?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never met them. That’s what made them perfect, there were no awkward hellos in the halls, there was no clickety-clacking of high heel shoes on hardwood floors, they may as well have been a family of cats just jumping around from drape to drape without that annoying ammonia urine smell.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m sure the new people will be just as quiet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t know that. How can you possibly know that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re right, I can’t. You know what? Anyone could rent that apartment now, an opera singer, the cast of stomp, yeah, a tap-dancing pirate with a wooden leg.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you making it worse?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I tried making it better, he wouldn’t go for it.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: You’re right, that’s a great idea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll take the apartment upstairs. I can finally get away from my mother, and we can all spend some more time together, if you catch my drift.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The horror!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on. You honestly expect me to believe that social protocol dictates we break our backs helping Wolowitz move, and then he only need buy us a pizza?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that really is how it works.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re tricking me. You tell me the truth, what do we get?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj, help me out here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You get to choose between a mountain bike or a PS3.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I knew it! PS3, definitely PS3, who would pick a mountain bike?

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice from inside)
utterance.content: Enough with the guilt, ma, we’ll still see each other. I’ll come over every night and have dinner with you.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: The hell you will! What am I running here, a fancy restaurant? Does this look like Olive Garden?

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Okay, I get it, you’re angry. You don’t want to see your little bird leave the nest.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Little bird? You’re almost 30, fly, for god’s sake!

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll stay! You happy, crazy lady? I sure as hell hope so, because you’re ruining my life!

utterance.speaker: Leonard (into phone)
utterance.content: Hey, Penny, it’s Leonard. Good news, you can take your head out of the oven.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (removing hernia support)
utterance.content: I guess I won’t be needing this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, the new ones, they’re here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stay calm, we don’t know anything about them yet. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m checking for musical instruments. Does that sound like castanets to you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The box says kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So? Do cocaine smugglers write cocaine on the box?

utterance.speaker: Blonde girl (arriving)
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Blonde Girl
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Blonde Girl
utterance.content: I’m Alicia. I’m moving in upstairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is so great. Oh, I’m Leonard, I live downstairs. Upstairs from here, but under you. Not under you per se, but under your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If that concludes your faltering attempt to mate, hello.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. On a scale of one to ten how light of foot would you describe yourself with one being not cat-like at all and ten being freakishly feline?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Freakishly feline?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that your answer or do you not understand the question? We’ll come back to that one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hang on. Are you now or have you ever been a salsa, Irish folk or break-dancer?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re making her uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. Well, if it helps you feel any better you’re doing very well so far. Next question, are you fertile?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying to determine whether crying infants above my head are a possibility.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: I have no immediate plans.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If that changes, let me know. And finally, area rugs, pro or con?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Pro?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alicia?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Welcome to the building.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity to help.

utterance.speaker: Penny (exiting apartment)
utterance.content: Oh, hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny. this is Alicia, our new neighbour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m helping.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can see.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alicia’s non-musical, childless and pro-rug. She’s still on probation, of course, but I like her.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Cool t-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I don’t usually dress like this. I’m going jogging.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t jog.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can start.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: True, but the more likely explanation for your attire is that you’re out of clean clothes again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re welcome, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Please, you look cute. I’m dressed like a slob today, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think you look fantastic.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: This one’s a player, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, be careful.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Thanks for the warning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: I’ll see you around.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: See ya. I’m dressed like a slob today, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, mimicry. I enjoy mimicry. I’ve been working on Admiral Ackbar from Return of the Jedi. “It’s a trap.” You have to imagine me with a giant squid head. “It’s a trap. It’s a trap. It’s a trap.”

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Congratulations, I see you did your laundry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, sort of.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How does one sort of…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I bought new clothes, okay? Is Leonard around?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s upstairs at Alicia’s.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. all right, that’s cool, no biggie. He said he’d help me set up my printer, but I guess I can wait. What exactly is he doing up there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In what I can only perceive as a tactical move to destroy me, he is with Wolowitz and Koothrappali setting up her stereo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, they’re all up there, huh? Hmm, typical.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s axiomatically atypical. Up until recently, they did not know Alicia, and had no encounters with her in a previous location. They never went upstairs to visit the former tenants, so your characterization of their behaviour as typical Is demonstrably fallacious.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, now I see the giant squid head.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, great! now, I have to start all over again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought about renting this apartment, but I’m really more of a downtown loft kind of guy.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Cool. so are you in a loft now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, actually I’m, uh, living with a woman in Altadena. Purely platonic, she’s also my maid.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Sounds like a sweet deal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I won’t lie, it’s pretty dope.

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I just wanted to bring you a little housewarming gift.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: That is so sweet. Come on in, let’s open it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Nice dress.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, this? I’m dressed like a slob today.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: The guys have been helping me set up my sound system. I’ve never had such good-looking technical support.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, pish-posh. I don’t know, it means shucks. Shucks means shucks. Let one go once in a while.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, uh, penny, you want to hear something awesome?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alicia is an actress, just like you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is so awesome.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Well, trying to be, but it’s so hard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: I’ve been out here three months, and all I’ve gotten is a couple of national commercials and this recurring thing on a soap.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s why I work at the Cheesecake Factory, I’m holding out for the right part.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alicia, what do you want as your default setting for DVDs, 5.1 Dolby or DTS?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Whatever you think is best, cutie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, DTS has more low end, so… okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, hey, guys, guys, you will really appreciate this, I read the best science joke on the internet. Alicia, you won’t get it, but it’s right up their alley. Anyway, so, this physicist goes into an ice cream parlour every week and orders an ice cream sundae for himself, and then offers one to the empty stool sitting next to him. This goes on for a while until the owner finally asks him what he’s doing. The man says, “well, I’m a physicist, and quantum mechanics teaches us that it is possible for the matter above this stool to spontaneously turn into a beautiful woman who might accept my offer and fall in love with me.” The owner then says, “well, lots of single, beautiful women come in here every day, why don’t you buy an ice cream for one of them, and they might fall in love with you?” And the physicist says, “yeah, but what are the odds of that happening?”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a little insulting, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How would I know? I’m not even sure I get it.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard? If you’re done with the DVD player, can you set up my printer?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I’d love to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, hey, maybe when you’re done with her printer, you could set up mine. You know, like you promised a week ago.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll get to it, don’t nag me.

utterance.speaker: Raj (drinking some wine)
utterance.content: Hello there

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who is it? Oh hello, Penny, it’s open, come in. Sarcasm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, they’re all still up there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think I can’t hear them? Listen to that. Stomp, stomp, stomp. That’s Wolowitz in his stacked heels that fool no one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t even know why I care. I don’t care. All right, I cared enough to memorize that stupid joke, but that’s all I care.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, Penny, there’s something that occurs in beehives you might find interesting. Occasionally, a new queen will arrive while the old queen is still in power. When this happens, the old queen must either locate to a new hive or engage in a battle to the death until only one queen remains.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you saying, that I’m threatened by Alicia? That I’m like the old queen of the hive and it’s just time for me to go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m just talking about bees. They’re on the discovery channel. What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bees. Aaah! I just got that physicist joke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gee, Penny, thanks for buying us dinner.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, what’s the occasion?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no occasion, just felt like getting some Chinese chow for my peeps.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you remember to ask for the chicken with broccoli to be diced, not shredded?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Even though the menu description specifies shredded?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brown rice, not white?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You stop at the Korean grocery and get the good hot mustard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you pick up the low-sodium soy sauce from the market?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. See how it’s done, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, what do we got going on tonight, huh? Playing Halo watching Battlestar, drop some mentos in diet coke?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want to watch Battlestar?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What can I say? I got my geek on, boys.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: No, no, PMS is different.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Oh, thank God you’re home. I need help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: I just got a callback to audition for CSI to play a hooker who gets killed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’d watch that.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: But my car is in the shop, and I have to be at Universal in forty-five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, I’ll take you.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Oh, you’re a lifesaver.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll run lines with you in the car.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Great. And afterward, I’ll take you all out for Chinese.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, actually, that’s okay. we already have…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yum. Starving.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: …chinese food right here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re gone, Penny. They can’t hear you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I cannot believe they’re letting her just use them like that. I mean, anything she wants, they go panting after her like trained dogs. You know that just last week, she had Howard drive all the way to her uncle’s house in Orange County to pick up her TV?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You once had Leonard and me get your television from your ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Apples and oranges here, Sheldon. I’m telling you, that girl is a user, iceskating through the life on her looks, taking advantage of innocent weak-willed men, getting auditions for stupid network shows. It creams my corn.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I interject something here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You got the wrong mustard.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Guess what? I got the part on CSI.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh boy.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, no. No, no, no, you know, congratulations, I think you’ll make a great hooker.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Thank you. Hey, I got to ask you something, how much do physicists make?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know, I don’t think a lot.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I figured. Well, got to run, the guys promised to set up my satellite dish and paint my bedroom. Yay!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, hey, hey, can I talk to you about that for a second?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you know, it’s just that Leonard and Howard and Raj, they aren’t like other guys. They’re special.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Okay, they’re special, and?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, let’s see, how can I explain this, um, they don’t know how to use their shields.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Shields?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, like in Star Trek, when you’re in battle and you raise the shields? Where the hell did that come from? Anyways, um, you know how guys like this are, so, please don’t take advantage of them.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Who says I’m taking advantage of them?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, they’re doing everything for you, because you’re leading them on.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: So I let them do stuff for me. They’re happy. I get stuff. Who cares? And how’s it any different from what you do?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: I’ve seen you around them. Are you pretending like you don’t do the exact same thing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, lady, you are way out of line.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Oh, I’m out of line?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re out of line.

utterance.speaker: Alicia
utterance.content: Well, what are you going to do about it, bitch?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I like green lantern, I’m just saying it’s pretty lame that He can be defeated by the colour yellow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Only the modern green lantern is vulnerable to yellow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Golden age green lantern was vulnerable to wood.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great, so I can take them both out with a number-two pencil?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God! Girl fight!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know you. you’re stupid enough to break it up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: May I say you look very comely tonight?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re right, this filly’s been broken.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (as music comes down through ceiling)
utterance.content: You set it on DTS, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I had to, she called me cutie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: According to Alicia’s facebook page, she’s hooking up with one of the producers on CSI.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, dead whore on TV, live one in real life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, great now she’s jumping up and down on the bed.
